DOC.brief_title: High-Intensity Interval Training Improving Fitness Patients With Stage I-III Breast Cancer Undergoing Chemotherapy With Trastuzumab
DOC.detailed_description: PRIMARY OBJECTIVES : I . To assess feasibility ( completion > 80 % exercise session ) utilize high-intensity interval training ( HIT ) . II . To determine effect HIT aerobic exercise adaptation compare moderate-intensity , continuous training ( MCT ) control ( CON ) . III . To examine effect HIT leave ventricular function compare MCT CON group . OUTLINE : Participants randomize 1 3 group . ARM I : Participants undergo HIT 30 minute , thrice weekly 12 week . ARM II : Participants undergo MCT 30 minute , thrice weekly 12 week . ARM III : Participants maintain current sedentary activity level ( < 60 minute total exercise per week ) 12 week . Participants document weekly activity exercise log . Following completion study visit , participant give option complete MCT exercise program Arm II . After completion study , patient follow week 13 25 .
